question: What type of forum did a former Soviet statesman initiate?

runs.question: What type of forum did a former Soviet statesman initiate?

steps.thought: To answer this question, I should find information about forums initiated by former Soviet statesmen. A search can help identify relevant forums and the statesmen involved.

action_input.query: forum initiated by former Soviet statesman

steps.observation: Found 10 relevant document(s): Nikolai Podgorny, Andrei Kirilenko (politician), MS Excelsior Neptune, Mikhail Suslov, Ephraim Sklyansky, World Summit of Nobel Peace Laureates, Anastas Mikoyan, Mikhail Gorbachev, David Waksberg, Sergo Mikoyan

steps.thought: The "World Summit of Nobel Peace Laureates" and "Mikhail Gorbachev" documents seem particularly relevant, as Gorbachev is a well-known former Soviet statesman who won the Nobel Peace Prize. He may have initiated a forum related to peace efforts.

action_input.title: World Summit of Nobel Peace Laureates

steps.observation: The World Summit of Nobel Peace Laureates was initiated by Mikhail Gorbachev in the 90s, as a forum in which the Nobel Peace Laureates and the Peace Laureate Organizations could come together to address global issues with a view to encourage and support peace and human well being in the world.  Its Permanent Secretariat is an independent, non-profit, ECOSOC non-governmental organization, based in Rome, operating on a permanent basis.  A permanent staff, mainly composed of volunteers, promotes the work of the Nobel Peace Prize Winners and organizes the World Summit of Nobel Peace Laureates on a yearly basis.  To date, the Permanent Secretariat has organized 16 Summits, the most recent having been held in February 2017 in the city of Bogota, Colombia.  This was the first time that the Summit took place in Latin America.

steps.thought: I have found the relevant information. Mikhail Gorbachev, a former Soviet statesman, initiated the World Summit of Nobel Peace Laureates in the 1990s.

action_input.answer: Mikhail Gorbachev, a former Soviet statesman, initiated the World Summit of Nobel Peace Laureates in the 1990s as a forum for Nobel Peace Laureates and Peace Laureate Organizations to address global issues and promote peace and well-being.

steps.observation: Task completed. Final answer: Mikhail Gorbachev, a former Soviet statesman, initiated the World Summit of Nobel Peace Laureates in the 1990s as a forum for Nobel Peace Laureates and Peace Laureate Organizations to address global issues and promote peace and well-being.

runs.final_answer: Mikhail Gorbachev, a former Soviet statesman, initiated the World Summit of Nobel Peace Laureates in the 1990s as a forum for Nobel Peace Laureates and Peace Laureate Organizations to address global issues and promote peace and well-being.

steps.observation: Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev, ( ; Russian: Михаи́л Серге́евич Горбачёв ; ] ; born 2 March 1931) is a former Soviet statesman.  He was the eighth and last leader of the Soviet Union, having been General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union from 1985 until 1991.  He was the country's head of state from 1988 until 1991 (titled as Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet from 1988 to 1989, as Chairman of the from 1989 to 1990, and as Soviet Union]] from 1990 to 1991).
